title: Intentional Action and Side-Effects in Ordinary Language

participants.population: People spending time in a Manhattan public park.

Experiment 1.population: People spending time in a Manhattan public park.

Experiment 2.population: People spending time in a Manhattan public park.

steps: Participants are randomly assigned to either a 'harm condition' or a 'help condition'.
Participants read a vignette (either about a corporate chairman or a military lieutenant) implementing a plan with a known side-effect that the agent claims not to care about.
Participants assess how much blame (in the harm condition) or praise (in the help condition) the agent deserves on a scale from 0 to 6.
Participants answer a categorical (Yes/No) question regarding whether the agent brought about the side-effect intentionally.
